recipe.title: Thai Grilled Aubergine Salad
recipe.description:
This is a very typical Thai salad known as 'laap' which is a finely chopped salad usually made with chicken or pork. It is also delicious made with grilled aubergines which are perfect for soaking up the sour and salty dressing.
Long Chinese aubergines are perfect for this, but the larger Mediterranean aubergines will also work fine. You just need to slice them into rounds before grilling.

directions.step: Preheat a barbecue or your oven grill. Prick the aubergines all over with a fork and place them on a grill tray in the oven about 5 inches from the heat. Alternatively place them on your barbecue. Turn the aubergines over occasionally and grill until they are well softened and browned, approximately 10-15 minutes. Set aside to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, place the rice in a wok or dry frying pan over medium heat. Toast the rice until golden, then grind in a good processor or a mortar and pestle until coarse.

Slice the aubergines in half and scrape out the flesh, discarding the charred skins. Place the aubergine pulp in a bowl and mash lightly with a fork. Stir in the remaining ingredients except for the toasted, ground rice and mix well. Sprinkle with the ground rice and serve.
